page.title: 04Transport Around Inverbervie
page.content: We no longer have a railway track in our D block so we depend on {buses, {taxis and private cars}for transport. An hourly bus service between Aberdeen and Montrose passes through Inverbervie. Buses are provided to take children to Secondary Schools in either Stonehaven or Laurencekirk. Children in the country are brought to school by one of the two {taxi firms} operating in the area. Only one main road runs through our area - A92 which is linked to the trunk road A94 by the B967. Many minor roads in good repair cross our block. Until the 1960's there were trains which ran from Inverbervie to Montrose. The track which was down by the sea has been lifted and houses have been built just next to it.
